fields.description:
To reproduce on IE7:

* Click in the Quick Nav Search field
* Press f5 to refresh the page
* After the page refresh, the cursor is still blinking in the Quick Nav Search field, as well as the grey text 'Search'.  The user can type search text, but there are no quick nav suggestions


This does not happen on Firefox or Safari
fields.summary: Refreshing page in IE can stop Quick Nav from working

fields.description:
To reproduce on QA-EAC:

Type 'quality' -> a match to the 'The Home of Quality' page is given

Type 'quality h' -> no matches
fields.summary: No matches given when a search term has only one letter

fields.description: To make the outcome of CONF-13170 available to all products we agreed to move our custom johnson filter to the atlassian-johnson package.
fields.summary: Move functionality of confluences custom johnson filter to atlassian-johnson

fields.description:
Encountered very strange behavior when Dynamic Table Macros was reporting this exception:
{noformat}
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.revere.confluence.dynamictable.model.Table
        at com.revere.confluence.dynamictable.TableManager.getTable(TableManager.java:28)
        at com.revere.confluence.dynamictable.DynamicTableMacro.execute(DynamicTableMacro.java:74)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.execute(ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.java:45)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.executeMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:297)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.processMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:255)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.makeMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:151)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.WikiContentRendererHandler.handleMacro(WikiContentRendererHandler.java:18)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.WikiMarkupParser.makeMacro(WikiMarkupParser.java:126)
        at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.WikiMarkupParser.makeMacro(WikiMarkupParser.java:114)
{noformat}


Dynamic Table Macros were installed on qa-eac before m5 was deployed and worked fine initially after m5 was deployed. However the problem started happening after I uninstalled/installed this plugin through confluence plugin repository. Uninstalling and then re-installing the plugin though "Manage Plugins" interface did not help.

I am creating this issue to investigate and make sure it is not an atlassian-plugins-2.1.x problem.
fields.summary: Problems when uninstalling and then installing Dynamic Table Macro though confluence plugin repository

fields.description:
Using the keyboard to navigate through table cells - up and down do not work as expected in Safari, they go left and right instead.

They work correctly on IE & FF
fields.summary: Cannot go up or down in tables on Safari
Label parser assumes label is present for user prefixes
Colour Picker does not work correctly with links

fields.description:
The office connector includes the viewfile macro. This macro allows you to view content from attachments inline. Customers find the macro a little bit heavy-weight. Adnan and I recently discussed using the ability to add exclamation points around a file name to make it viewable. 

The best way to implement this would be as a new plugin type. That way new file types could be added. So for example, if you wanted to include the contents from a java source file attached to the page. You could write an extension to pretty print the file and a user would only have to type !MyClass.java! and an html view of the source code would be inserted into the page. 

The other use case is of course the Office Connector where you could do something !presentation.ppt! to insert the contents of a presentation.
fields.summary: Make a new plugin type for viewable content placed between wiki text exclamation points "!"
Replace newline '\\' markup with '\n'

fields.description: I spoke to Renan and apparently this was removed intentionally after Confluence 2.7, but it's a useful feature so can we put it back into the latest default theme?
fields.summary: Add "printer-friendly version" icon to every Page in Confluence 2.9 theme

fields.description:
Confluence's sitemesh filter applies only to certain paths, it limits [standard plugin decoration functionality|http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1673858351#AtlassianPlugins2.1MigrationGuide-Step5ImplementtheStandarddecorators]. 
There are also sitemesh exclusions(noop decorators) defined in decorators.xml file. In particular {{/plugins/* }} is excluded.

Ideally we want all plugin generated content to go through the filter so that it can be decorated if needed.
fields.summary: standard sitemesh filter should be applied to plugin-generated content so that it can be decorated if needed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page with some content
# Edit said page and delete all content in wiki markup
# Switch to Rich Text
# Alll the text is still there

This also still happens when going through markup -> preview -> rte

However this doesn't happen the other way rte -> wiki markup

I doubt this use case will happen all that often, but its definitely annoying.
fields.summary: Deleting all content from Wiki Markup is not preserved when switching to Rich Text

fields.description:
h1. Summary
h2. Symptom A

When searching for a dashed word, the dash character does not appear in the search results and the hit is not highlighted, making the recognition of the desired result difficult.
h2. Symptom B

Dashes can also be treated as spaces and result in matching the individual words joined by the dash. A search for external-services would have matches for pages with just the individual words external and services.
h2. Steps to reproduce
h3. Symptom A
 # Create a page with the following text:
{quote}This is a built-in functionality that excites many users. We built it ourselves years ago.
{quote}
 # Search Confluence for the keyword {{built-in}}.

h3. Symptom B
 # Create a page (A) with the following text:
{quote}This would fall under external-services
{quote}
 # Create a page (B) with the following:
{quote}This is external to the company
{quote}
 # Create a page (C) with the following:
{quote}This is a list of services
{quote}
 # Search Confluence for the keyword {{external-services}}

h2. Expected Results
h3. Symptom A

The search results should return the page above with the word "built-in" bolded.
{quote}This is a *built-in* functionality that excites many users. We built it ourselves years ago.
{quote}
h3. Symptom B

Search results would only show page A
h2. Actual Results
h3. Symptom A

The search results returns the page above with the word "built" bolded and the dash is removed from the word "built-in".
{quote}This is a builtin functionality that excites many users. We *built* it ourselves years ago.
{quote}
h3. Symptom B

Search results match on pages B and C
fields.summary: Using dashes in Confluence searches causes inaccurate results

fields.description:

The Mac OS mail client will display a blank message if the mail is viewed when there is no network connectivity to confluence.  (Perhaps my VPN connection is down....)

I suspect this is related to the external stylesheet linked in the mail.

Getting warnings of the form:

{noformat}
WARN [TP-Processor7] [atlassian.confluence.renderer.DefaultMacroManager] getPluginMacro Expected one plugin module for macro 'htmlcomment' but found 2. 
Using plugin module: com.adaptavist.confluence.contentFormattingMacros:HTMLcomment

in the EAC sysout.log (my newlines). I thought HTMLComment was in the "Content Formatting Macros Plugin" but it might be somewhere else because I'm not seeing "found 2" warnings for other content macros like lozenges. Has HTMLComment shifted between plugin versions? 

See writeup in [CONFMON space|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFMON/atlassian.confluence.renderer.DefaultMacroManager] for details.

fields.description:
I am experience an error with exporting a page as a PDF. The file is created however the user never receives the exported PDF. I can find the file on the server. However in the logs it returns the following error,

2008-10-13 12:24:20,668 ERROR [catalina-exec-7] [confluence.servlet.download.ExportDownload] getStreamForDownload com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.DownloadResourceNotFoundException: Could not find file: //var/tmp/confluence/temp/export_10132008_122417/MHOST-6882956-20081013-12_24_173.pdf
 -- url: /confluence/download//var/tmp/confluence/temp/export_10132008_122417/MHOST-6882956-20081013-12_24_173.pdf | userName: <user name removed>

I have not been able to find any information about this, that exactly fits my issue and any help would be great!
fields.summary: Error when exporting page to PDF and then displaying it to user.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. In a table cell, press enter 3+ times
2. Press save


This only affects IE because it puts in paragraphs by default when you press enter. I'm not quite sure how to fix that, cause we can't simply just override the enter keypress event and stop even propagation (that stops the cursor moving to the next line).
fields.summary: Pressing enter several times when editing a table in the RTE results in a new row after saving

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13375].
  {panel}

Hello there!

A subset of our Confluence user community has recently expressed their desire to have, after clicking the print button, the option to have all attachments included with the print. Expanding on that idea, they would also like the ability to export to PDF/Word with attachments too (where feasible), the ability to select which attachments get included in the print, and the order they are printed in. (All of this is relative to the page context. They are thinking that, while they are reading a specific page, they would click print and have all this happen.)

Thanks so much!
-Gray
Medical School Information Services
University of Michigan
fields.summary: Feature Request: Option to print attachments with page

fields.description:
This issue has different symptoms from [CONF-10535|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-10535] in that:
* Alphabetical View is not affected
* FireFox is not affected
* Problem can be evident with as little as 300 ~ 800 pages.
* Occurs when you have "too many" pages visible at one time, either because you have a parent page with lots of children or becuase you have opened lots of parent nodes with a small amount of children.

When you browse a space, and select Tree View, this will cause IE7 to hang.  The hang appears to be on the client side only as the contents of the tree looks to be received from the server based on observations with Fiddler.  Performing the same action with FireFox works fine.  IE consumes the CPU and the memory usage continually grows. 

To reproduce the problem, browse our CAC space (currently on 2.9.2-rc1) here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Home
Expand *Home*.  The Knowledge Base has about 870 articles rooted under Home.
fields.summary: Tree View hangs Internet Explorer when viewing lots of pages at once

fields.description:
We have developed a new wiki using confluence.

https://altium.onconfluence.com/dashboard.action

We have a template which has macros. We use a small icon to indicate that we are publishing a link, this is part of the template {ref-reading}, see here: https://altium.onconfluence.com/display/ADOH/Verifying+Your+Design+in+Altium+Designer

If we put a link inside the macro, it doesn't work. So we put ahref into WIKI markup to link to another page. This is really annoying as it means we will have to manually update the links if something changes. If you save and then it reopens in rich text editor, the html is completely stripped out.

This is causing us major problems.
Also, this may or may not be a bonus but the rich text editor is not there when you use google chrome.
fields.summary: Cannot add a link inside macro. So instead use html within macro but this is stripped out completely when you save and then open in rich text editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13370].
  {panel}

I think that the headings in Confluence are too hard to distinguish from one another.

The difference between e.g. heading 1 and heading 2 seems to be maybe 2 pixels in the font size, while they're both bold and underlined. This makes it impossible to see which one is which when scrolling through a document.

Same thing with heading 3, 4 and 5: there's only a slight variation in font size that makes them different from each other.

On a side note, I know that many people think that heading 1 is too big and takes up too much space, and are using heading 5 as their main heading.
fields.summary: headings in Confluence are too hard to distinguish from one another.

fields.description:
e.g. you have an image called  "Zusammenhänge.jpg" and reference to it like 
!Zusammenhänge.jpg! the pdf export will fail.

Short error message is:
{code}
Caused by: javax.xml.transform.TransformerException: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The entity name must immediately follow the '&' in the entity reference.
{code}

full stack trace is attached
fields.summary: Images with umlauts, which are referenced on a page, crashes PDF-Export

fields.description:
At the moment, we _only_ score matches when they _all_ search term(s) match a certain field. That is, searching for "crowd roadmap" will get a score in the labels field if a document has both {{crowd}} and {{roadmap}} labels.

However, if the title of a document only contains _one_ of the two search terms say "Roadmap", the fact that this document had _one match_ in the title is completely disregarded during scoring. 

My case is that ignoring matches like this during scoring is bad and will lead to less relevant results. 

Instead, we should score all matches in all fields. 

We can still enforce {{AND}} as the default operator. What this means is that all terms will be required to occur in at least one of the multiple fields specified. 

That is, if the required fields are {{title}}, {{body}} and {{labels}}, and the search is "crowd roadmap", the old query is: 

(title:"crowd AND roadmap") OR (body:"crowd AND roadmap") OR (labels:"crowd AND roadmap")

We should change this to: 

(title:crowd body:crowd labels:crowd) AND (title:roadmap body:roadmap labels:roadmap)
fields.summary: Improve relevancy of search results by ensuring that all matches in any field contributes to the scoring

fields.description:
From the Language Configuration page, click on a flag to change the language (e.g. change from English to French)

The left-hand menu items, the footer, and the drop down menu items will all change to the new language.

However the page title, the page text, and the breadcrumbs will all remain in the original language.  The user must refresh the page to see these items translated. 

It seems to me that it would make sense for the page to automatically refresh, so that all items are translated at the same time.
fields.summary: Not all items are translated straight after selecting a language on the Language Configuration page

fields.description:
Using Firefox 3.0.3. Open a new Confluence page or comment. Open a MS Word 2007 document. Copy all. Then Paste into the Rich Text editor in Confluence. You will find that garbled metadata appears in the saved page. The metadata contains lots of "Unknown macro: {mso-level-number-format}" or similar comments. (Please see Screenshots.)

Then the Confluence 2.7.x server appears to lock up corresponding with approximately the same timing.

fields.description:
Using the RTE, enter the warning emoticon by typing (!)

Preview or save, and the text is displayed as entered, instead of the symbol.  Checking the Wiki Markup tab shows that the RTE has added in an escape character.


The text should be converted to the symbol.  All the other emoticons work this way.
fields.summary: Warning sign emoticon is escaped when entered in RTE

TransactionManager not injected into a servlet module in a v2 plugin

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

   1. Click the Add Link button
   2. Enter some Link text (eg: http://www.atlassian.com)
   3. Leave Alias text empty
   4. Enter some Tooltip text (eg: Google!)
   5. Click OK

Switching between rich text and wiki markup will show you that the link is generated like this:

{noformat}[http://www.google.com.au|Google]{noformat}
_This is wrong because the tool tip needs to be the *third parameter*_
fields.summary: Creating a link with tooltip but no alias results in a badly formed link

fields.description: Noticed a problem with scrolling when using the Classic Theme in Internet Explorer. The behavior is that there is about a quarter of an inch or smaller space at the right side of the browser just past the Search button.
fields.summary: Classic theme scroll display is minimised when using IE browser

fields.description:
"You can move the highlighted page by dragging it to a new position in the tree."

I think that the above statement needs to be reworded and a little bit more obvious in how to relocate a page. I thought it would be straight forward, but instead found it quite difficult to relocate a page.
fields.summary: Rephrasing instructions on relocating a page.

fields.description:
If you attach an image with apostrophe's in the filename, the *Insert Image* page will not be able to render the thumbnail for that image.  Also, clicking on the filename doesn't automatically will not automatically place the filename into the *filename* field.

Moved the 2nd part of this issue to CONF-13642.
fields.summary: Images with apostrophe in the filename causes Insert Image page thumbnails to break

fields.description:
There seems to be a *fundamental* problem with the velocity templates Space.pdfexport.vm and Space.htmlexport.vm (likely because both these templates have a displayContentNodeAndChildren macro method). Although not reproducible consistently -- the intermediate xsl FO object that is generated before exporting to Pdf (or HTML etc.) contains content that is interleaved between *.htmlexport.vm and *.pdfexport.vm. View the FO object snippet below: {code:xml} • SDK Installation
  • SDK Patch Installation
    • • SDK Overview {code} Notice the {noformat}
  • {noformat} element within the {noformat}{noformat} element? There is no reference (there should be no way) that an
  • element gets written out to this XSL FO object when attempting to export to PDF. The
  • element is relevant only for HTML exports. This could potentially be an issue with the way the underlying VelocityEngine returns templates (the getVelocityEngine().getTemplate(templateName, encoding) method in VelocityUtils) or the way the engine invokes the macros defined in these templates. (Notice that both Space/Page.pdfexport.vm and Space/Page.htmlexport.vm share the same macro displayContentNodeAndChildren
fields.summary: VelocityEngine multi threading issue in creating intermediate xsl FO object when attempting to export space/page to Pdf

fields.description:
TinyMCE adds additional vertical spacing below the metadata in the below example.

# Create a blank, new wiki page. Go to the Wiki Markup tab and add the code in the attached file.
# Click on Rich Text. Note the extra vertical space between metadata-list and Sign In.
# Delete the extra vertical space in the WYSIWYG. Click on the Wiki Markup tab. Click on the Rich Text tab. The vertical space is back.
fields.summary: TinyMCE adds vertical space where it doesn't belong
"show children" should not cause page load

fields.description:
The search box (not Quick Search) was vertically squashed in the display while using Classic Theme. Within IE (IE_search.jpg), the search query is readable, however, the 'Search' box is small. On the other hand, within FireFox 2 (firefox_search.jpg), the search query is not readable.

Steps to reproduce:
# Use Classic Theme
# Search for a page content via Quick Search
# See the right hand Search box of the results display

Workaround:
Use Default Theme

fields.description:
The clicking on the title of a comment to minimise it is very off putting from a usability point of view. Functionally it doesn't do very much as the state of the comments aren't remembered.

Can we have a minimise button, as unobtrusive as the link icon, next to the date of a comment that the user can use to minimise a comment.
fields.summary: Change the click to collapse for individual comments

See the screen recording attached.

You will notice that 2 urls are dragged into the rich text box. The first one that is inline does not become a url when published, in fact extra characters are added to the end of it.

The second one that is dragged to a blank line works as expected.

However, regardless of what it was set to, submitting the form will set it to "false".  It looks like the form isn't being properly populated with the current value.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13322].
  {panel}

Not sure if the macro was the cause or not:

{noformat}

	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)

fields.summary: ClassCastException, after clicking on the {rsvp} macro, rendered in a comment.

fields.description:
See screenshot.

Also, I believe we should change the colour to something less scary. Blue or yellow would be fine, after all it is not a big error
fields.summary: Uploading an unsupported image format produces double error-message

fields.description:
When a user creates a personal space they get an option to allow others to edit that personal space.

Currently the default is that that other users can't edit. This causes many issues attaching items to be used in comments on the page. The default should be that others can edit, and the user can select not to allow editing by others.
fields.summary: Make personal space editable by others by default

fields.description:
My problem appears to be a reintroduction of the previously resolved bug CONF-5848.

I verified that it worked correctly in 2.3.3, we just noticed it this week after upgrading to 2.9.1.

{blog-posts:labels=foo} results in all news being shown if the label foo is not attached to any news items. 

I did find that if I used match-labels=all as in the following:

{blog-posts:labels=foo|match-labels=all}

No news items were found, which is the correct behavior.   

Dean
fields.summary: blog-posts + label that doesn't exist result in all news shown

fields.description:
See attachment:

Attach Files to User Profile is no longer relevant since we now have personal spaces, but it is still available in our UI. We should remove it.

From our docs:
This allows the user to upload files to be stored in their user profile.
Attaching files to a user profile was a feature made obsolete by personal spaces. This permission is therefore not relevant since Confluence 2.2.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+overview
fields.summary: obsolete feature should be removed from the UI - "Attach Files to User Profile"

fields.description:
I tried posting this URL into a Confluence page: http://example.com/users/{user}

Confluence complains about the braces but it seems to be impossible to escape them. Ideally, I shouldn't need to escape the braces at all.
fields.summary: Confluence pages refuse to render RESTful URLs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Attach a file to PageA in SpaceA
# For SpaceA, grant userA with "View" and "Create Page" permissions only. User should be able to see edit attachment link (CONF-11453)
# Login as userA
# Edit attachment of PageA in SpaceA
# Specify a page to move the attachment to
# Click OK

The following stack trace will be prompted:

{quote}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.validate(MoveAttachmentAction.java:175)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.interceptors.CaptchaInterceptor.intercept(CaptchaInterceptor.java:46)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.LoggingContextInterceptor.intercept(LoggingContextInterceptor.java:48)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.CancellingInterceptor.intercept(CancellingInterceptor.java:23)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.actions.PermissionCheckInterceptor.intercept(PermissionCheckInterceptor.java:54)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
       ...
{quote}

A more *friendly message* should be prompted, as it *was* in Confluence prior to version 2.9 (see screenshot [^move_in_281]):

bq. You do not have permission to move this attachment to the space spaceA.

Although Confluence behaves as expected (by disallowing user to move attachment), the stack trace could cause some confusion
fields.summary: NullPointerException thrown if user cannot move attachments

fields.description: After pressing return I wouldn't expect the quicknav to open up anymore. I just first got a timeout and then a dropdown even though I had hit return, and the pages jumped to the search results the next second. Not a horrible bug, but obviously wrong.
fields.summary: Quick navigation pops up even after pressing return

fields.description:
It should work like the right arrow button currently does in tables.

If there is a list in that table cell, the tabbing in the list should take precedence. So, tabbing when I'm in a list in a cell should indent the list rather than go to the next cell.
fields.summary: Tabbing in a table in the RTE should take you to the next cell

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13313].
  {panel}

JIRAStudio received a lot of very good feedback from a non intrusive text box at the head of a page which let users provide feedback from any page in the product at any time.

This would be very useful on Extranet when we release features in particular milestones. We should go by how the Studio team did this, but at a minimum, it should be:

# Subtle initially and then open up to multi-line field.
# Emails all feedback to Product Manager and anyone else who wants it

Perhaps we can do this on CAC when we upgrade it before a release too.
fields.summary: Feedback Bar for extranet milestone releases
Remove the Bamboo Theme

fields.description:
Please add Oracle 11g to the list of DBMSs that we support.
10g is getting a bit long in the tooth, and 11g has been out for a while now.
fields.summary: Support for Oracle 11g

fields.description:
We deprecated the classic theme in the 2.9 docs. We can now remove it in 2.10.

It would involve writing an upgrade task to migrate existing spaces with classic theme to the default theme. And maybe disable/uninstall the classic theme?
fields.summary: Remove Classic Theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13308].
  {panel}

Taken from [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13277]

According to this document, [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Deleted+Page], and every version of this document in past versions of Confluence:

    When you restore a page, you are retrieving it from 'Trash' to the same location in the space where it existed before it was deleted.

This is not the case. When you restore a page, the page is restored to the root of the space, not to it's original location. Example: spaceroot > First > Second > Third. If you delete Second and then restore, Second is now located at spaceroot > Second.


It would be much better if the deleted page was restored to it's original location.  Note that when this change is made, CONF-13277 should be updated to ensure that the documentation correctly describes the actual behaviour.
fields.summary: Restoring a deleted page should restore it to the original location
Posting Date does not appear in RSS Macro

fields.description:
When moving a page using the page ordering pagetree, a notification is sent about the page move. The notification shows the creator, not the person who made the move, for "Page Moved By".

The screenshot shows the email I got after moving a page Tony created.
fields.summary: Page Moved sends notification from creator, not current user

fields.description:
{pagetree2:space=spacekey} didn't work under IE6. 

The treemap is frozen in "loading" status and produces a JavaScript popup window with the following error message : "session error"

!session_error.gif!

I didn't found anything else this link about a similar JS error : http://www.adaptavist.com/display/Builder/Session%20Error

I tried to contact adaptavist and the response was :  "Sorry we no longer maintain this plugin, you should contact atlassian directly. "

So here I'm, does anynone have any ideas or solutions please ?
fields.summary: pagtree2 : JS popup "session error" with IE6

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Copy a coloured text from Word (attach is an example document [^Sample.doc])
# In IE, paste the text into Confluence's Rich Text Editor
# The coloured text appears as it is in the Editor
# Save the page
# The text is now displayed in black (The colour information has lost)

Occurs both in IE6 and IE7. Works fine in Firefox.
fields.summary: Word text pasted into Rich Text Editor loses colour information in IE

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:

# Browse Space
# Go to Space Admin-> Edit Space Details
# Clicking Insert Link
# Enter link (no matter local or external)
# Click 'OK'

JavaScript error occurs in _insertlink.action_ in line 234: opener has no properties
fields.summary: Cannot add link to space description
Cannot edit location for page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13301].
  {panel}

The page picker actions are broken in various ways including:
* Vague/Inconsistent use of currentSpace and spaceKey fields
* Located in the user package when it clearly has nothing to do with user actions
* SpacePickerAction does not appear to be used in any way
* SpacePickerAction does not do anything significantly different to its superclass PagePickerAction
fields.summary: Clean up pagepicker actions
RTE automatically creates a strikethrough

fields.description:
TinyMCE seems to remove HTML tags within the body of macros, in this case the SQL macro.

See this edit here:

http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=700842012&originalVersion=13&revisedVersion=14#change20

Where I changed the name of the page, and the anchor tags were removed by the editor.
fields.summary: TinyMCE removes tags in SQL macro

fields.description:
This method performs a tremendous amount of queries, which get slower and slower as it loads more and more entities into the Hibernate Session.
This results in user creation / browsing taking an extremely long amount of time when there are many users in the system (and an unlimited license is not used).
fields.summary: getUsersWithConfluenceAccessAsList is really, really slow
Nul
Inconsistent List rendering between browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13294].
  {panel}

Create a way for Confluence to remember its JVM parameters or previous settings (eg. LDAP) so that the same parameters or configurations do not need to be added/applied again in the upgraded version.

At the moment when one sets a JVM parameter for Confluence, eg. Xmx, permgen, etc. the value will not be carried over to the new upgraded version. The same goes for Confluence settings eg. *atlassian-user.xml* this has to be done manually all over again.

A customer gave a good comment on this matter:
{quote}
I now realize we went through this same support issue before! Increasing permgen size. 

You can search our history. But what happened is that it was lost in the upgrade (we didn't merge it over). 
:
:
Although the way Conf/JIRA upgrades are done is our #1 complaint about Conf/JIRA. The upgrade process is so painful we dread doing Conf/JIRA upgrades and put them off for six months or a year sometimes. 

_Having to hand merge over files seems completely anachronistic._ 

Settings like permgensize and database and user authentication should live _OUTSIDE_ the install folder and thus should survive an upgrade. It is hard to comprehend the way you do it, how people accept merging that stuff over by hand even for the most minor upgrade. It makes for a horrible user experience.

The bottom line is you probably expect IT professional will admin this stuff. We are software engineers but not IT professional. So our expectations are very different. I would expect an upgrade to be automatic and never required hand editing anything.
:
:
Those are our standing complaints: upgrades and memory settings. Once it's up and running we like Conf & JIRA, they are good products overall, just the admin/install part is lacking.
{quote}
fields.summary: Remember previous  version's JVM parameters and other Confluence settings so that an admin does not need to reapply the settings again in the upgraded version

fields.description:
The content of the Confluence Demo Space will be updated for Confluence 2.10.
The space is house on EAC at http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DRAFTDEMO/
See documentation task CONF-13144

When content is complete, please export the DRAFTDEMO space from EAC and include it in the Confluence 2.10 shipment.
fields.summary: Confluence Demo Space - include updated content in the Confluence 2.10 release

fields.description: With the ClassLoading hack rolledback, Confluence's startup time has increased significantly (particularly on Resin). We need an alternative mechanism for speeding up the loading of Bundled plugins.
fields.summary: Speed up Confluence's startup time (again)

fields.description:
Try the following wiki markup:
{noformat}

|| Task || Done ||
| Start off with the general [Staff Induction|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HR/Staff+Induction+-+New+Employee+Checklist]. | |
| Explore the [Support Team Structure|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/STAFF/Staff+Contact+List]. | |
{noformat}

In the RTE, delete the first entry of the table. You then cannot delete the empty line - you have to go into wiki markup ande delete | | |.
fields.summary: Cannot delete a row in a table
Ampersands are not always escaped correctly.

fields.description: getting text fields in the middle of my page and i don't know why, see screenshot
fields.summary: Uninvited text fields in page body
